data.author: Pliny the Elder
data.en: No mortal man, moreover is wise at all moments.

data.author: Pliny the Elder
data.en: The depth of darkness to which you can descend and still live is an exact measure of the height to which you can aspire to reach.

data.author: Pliny the Elder
data.en: There is always something new out of Africa.

data.author: Pliny the Elder
data.en: An object in possession seldom retains the same charm that it had in pursuit.

data.author: Pliny the Elder
data.en: The best plan is to profit by the folly of others.

data.author: Pliny the Elder
data.en: In comparing various authors with one another, I have discovered that some of the gravest and latest writers have transcribed, word for word, from former works, without making acknowledgment.

data.author: Pliny the Elder
data.en: From the end spring new beginnings.

data.author: Pliny the Elder
data.en: It is generally much more shameful to lose a good reputation than never to have acquired it.

data.author: Pliny the Elder
data.en: The lust of avarice as so totally seized upon mankind that their wealth seems rather to possess them than they possess their wealth.

data.author: Pliny the Elder
data.en: The only certainty is that nothing is certain.

data.author: Pliny the Elder
data.en: Such is the audacity of man, that he hath learned to counterfeit Nature, yea, and is so bold as to challenge her in her work.

data.author: Pliny the Elder
data.en: Home is where the heart is.

data.author: Pliny the Elder
data.en: Grief has limits, whereas apprehension has none. For we grieve only for what we know has happened, but we fear all that possibly may happen.

data.author: Pliny the Elder
data.en: In these matters the only certainty is that nothing is certain.

data.author: Pliny the Elder
data.en: Hope is the pillar that holds up the world. Hope is the dream of a waking man.
